name: Austria
description: Austria blends the best of old-world charm, cosmopolitan city life, and breathtaking Alpine landscapes. Our Austria vacation packages can take you wandering the old town of Salzburg or tracing the footsteps of Mozart. Step onto the living set of the Sound of Music. Vienna’s Baroque and Rococo architecture rings with classical music. Feel the spirit of Klimt, Mozart, Freud, and Mahler in the city’s cafés. Beyond Vienna, journey to the Danube Valley, and visit Austria’s national parks for alpine hiking. In the winter, the mountain resorts come alive.
weather: Depends on the season. Spring and fall bring temperatures in the mid 40s to high 60s. June to August brings temperatures in the 70s. And winter brings chilly weather in the 30s and 40s.
bestTimeToVisit: Fall and spring are quieter times to visit and offer milder temperatures, while winter brings crowds to the Alpine resorts

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Hofburg
thingsToDo.text: The Hofburg is the Imperial Palace in Vienna, the capital city of Austria. In the days of old this would have been the home of the Royal Family who were known as the Hasburgs. Nowadays however the palace is used by the President although parts of it can also be visited by the public.

thingsToDo.name: Trek the Krimmler Ache
thingsToDo.text: The Krimmler Ache is the tallest waterfall in Austria and it has a drop of 380 meters. To get here you will first have to make your way to the delightful town of Krimml which sits at 1,076 meters above sea level before trekking out to the Krimmler Ache. From Krimml you will find a selection of exquisite hiking trails to choose from and this is a great spot to spend several days enjoying the great Austrian outdoors.

thingsToDo.name: Pay tribute to Mozart in Salzburg
thingsToDo.text: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart was born in Salzburg in Austria in 1756. His humble home at Number 9 Getreidegasse has now been turned into a museum which is aptly named Mozart’s Birthplace and you will find family memorabilia, musical instruments, and paintings of Mozart all over the house.

thingsToDo.name: Hike the Kitzbüheler Horn
thingsToDo.text: Standing proud in the Tyrol Region of Austria is the Kitzbüheler Horn which is almost 2,000 meters high. It is known for being one of the most spectacular peaks in Austria and you can take a cable car to the top or trek to the summit from the village of Kitzbühel if you are feeling active. Once at the top, you will have views all over the scenic valleys blow.

thingsToDo.name: Go skiing in Arlberg
thingsToDo.text: Austria is of course famous for its ski resorts but one of the most popular of these is Arlberg. Both professional and beginner skiers love Arlberg as there are a range of runs here for all levels of ability and the main ski resort provides ski equipment and classes.

places.name: Vienna
places.description: Whether you want to see the Bruegel masterpieces at the Museum of Fine Arts, listen to Mozart at the Vienna State Opera, or delve into Vienna’s culinary scene at the Naschmarkt, our vacation consultant can match you with a Vienna vacation package that’s just your style. Explore this city of palaces with a local guide or enjoy one of our insider experiences at a neighborhood tavern.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Schonbrunn Palace
thingsToDo.text: Standing since the 1600’s and holding a major role of cultural importance in Austria, the Schonbrunn Palace is a colossal 1441 room structure and complex that is the main tourist attraction in Vienna. Inside the palace are an assortment of rooms all fully furnished and decorated in the original style – You can enjoy a tour through the rooms and admire the sumptuous furnishings and see how Austrian royalty lived.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the St Stephen’s Cathedral
thingsToDo.text: This monolithic structure stands proud in the Stephensplatz and has been the most important church in Vienna and Austria since its construction. As an iconic building of Vienna, St Stephens cannot be missed!

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Schonbrunn Gardens
thingsToDo.text: Another exceptional part to the Schonbrunn Palace Complex and worthy of a separate visit in its own right, the gardens at Schonbrunn are simply magical. The crowning glory to all of this is the Gloriette which stands opposite the palace and features a pool and a classical colonnaded long building – Enjoy a drink here in the cafe or simple admire the views of the whole gardens in front of you.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Vienna Natural History Museum
thingsToDo.text: Housed in a sophisticated palace complex that is typical of the historical architecture in Vienna, the Natural History Museum has a huge collection of minerals, precious stones, meteorites, fossils, skeletons of animals, displays of various insects and mammals and even some taxidermy of extinct species. Adults and children alike will love the sheer amount of information and eye-boggling displays in this epic museum.

places.name: Salzburg
places.description: Situated in central Austria, near the German border, Salzburg is probably best known as the birthplace of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. Travelers come to Austria’s fourth-largest city to view the sights that inspired such unforgettable music. With its hill-topped medieval fortress, picturesque Altstadt old town and breath-taking Alpine scenery, Salzburg’s beauty is sure to enchant visitors in every season of the year.

thingsToDo.name: See the Hoheensalzburg Fortress
thingsToDo.text: Wander around the medieval rooms and courtyard, enjoy panoramic views of the city spread out below, and see the Prince’s Chambers which is one of Europe’s most well-preserved secular Gothic buildings.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Mozart's birtplace
thingsToDo.text: It’s hard to miss the building’s bright yellow façade in the town centre, which is now home to a museum dedicated to the famous composer and one of the most popular Salzburg attractions. Walk through what used to be his family’s apartment, admire his musical instruments, and see other memorabilia dating back to the 18th century.

thingsToDo.name: See the Salzburg Cathedral
thingsToDo.text: Salzburg Cathedral (Dom zu Salzburg) is one of the city’s most beautiful landmarks and found in the historic centre. Dating back centuries, the whitewashed, baroque building features a crypt, seven bells, a baptismal font where famous composers where baptized, and even graffiti that’s about 400 years old.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Hellbrunn Palace
thingsToDo.text: Take a boat ride over to Hellbrunn Palace, the cheery, sunshine-yellow castle best known for its trick fountains. This ‘pleasure palace’ (get your mind out of the gutter!) was built in 1615 as a holiday spot, and the local archbishops loved wandering through the gardens to see the water features, geysers and grottos.

places.name: Zell am See
places.description: Tucked away in an idyllic valley among the majestic Kitzbuhel Alps, the alpine city of Zell am See is as picture-perfect as they come. The small city is set on the shores of a vividly blue lake, from which it draws its name, with cosy chalets and flower-filled meadows coating the slopes.

thingsToDo.name: Stay at a cottage overlooking the lake
thingsToDo.text: The lake with the same name as the village, Zeller See, has an area of about 5 square kilometers and is surrounded by chic chalets and the high peaks of the Alps. The view is fabulous at all times, so it would be a shame not to enjoy it right from your room window.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the lake on a boat or water bike
thingsToDo.text: 5 km of water, swans, boats, colorful cabins, greenery and the snowy ridges of the mountains. That’s what the beautiful lake near the village of Zell am See, the one you can explore long and wide, both on the shore and on the water, looks like.

thingsToDo.name: Ride the Alpine Coaster
thingsToDo.text: Well, probably not even a serious ski session will give you the strong feelings you will feel when riding the roller coaster in Kaprun, the village neighboring Zell am See. In figures, it would translate to 730 meters to the top, 1300 meters back to the base and 40 km/h maximum speed. The good part is that the speed depends entirely on you, as you will have a lever to control it throughout the route.

thingsToDo.name: Go hiking
thingsToDo.text: There are several walking and hiking tours, the most popular being Pinzgauer Spaziergang, 19 kilometers long. Starts in Zell am See and ends in Saalbach.

name: Czech Republic
description: Located in the heart of Central Europe, the Czech Republic is one of the most sought-after destinations. This modern little country with an exciting history and deep-rooted traditions boasts of castles and chateaux, elegant spas resorts and stunning national parks, and of course, the world’s finest Pilsner beer. Whether you want to experience the magic of Prague or explore the country's medieval towns, our consultants can customize your trip with just the right Czech Republic vacation package to make it a one-of-a-kind trip
weather: Overall, it is moderately continental, with cold winters (December-February being the coldest) and warm summers. Always check local weather before traveling.
bestTimeToVisit: May-September is considered the busiest season, as most festivals and activities are held to make the most of the good weather.

thingsToDo.name: Dine in the Dancing House
thingsToDo.text: Officially known as Nationale-Nederlanden building, it is a fine example of contemporary architecture. Besides being a famous landmark, the building houses Celeste Restaurant, which welcomes the locals and city’s guests.

thingsToDo.name: Hit the Pubs
thingsToDo.text: The Czech Republic is a famous producer of beer. Various brands produce numerous blends, that have gain notoriety in Europe. Meanwhile, a lot of historic pubs are still open and invite guests to check out the local production!

thingsToDo.name: Visit Olomouc
thingsToDo.text: One of the biggest towns in the country has a Medieval university, which attracts young people from around. Moreover, it boasts an abundance of historic monuments protected by UNESCO.

thingsToDo.name: Walk the Charles Bridge
thingsToDo.text: One of the most popular landmarks in Prague, it also qualifies as one of the most iconic bridges in the world! Commissioned by King Charles IV, the construction of the structure was finished in the 15th century.

thingsToDo.name: Relax in Karlovy Vary
thingsToDo.text: Also known as Carlsbad, be introduced to the famous spa town. It boasts hot springs, whose water is used for various purposes. Pools and spa centers attract visitors from all over the country as well as Europe to have some pleasurable treatments.

places.name: Prague
places.description: One of Europe’s most fascinating cities, Prague has a skyline of cathedrals, fairy-tale castles and soaring towers. And down below, a vibrant urban center, nestled amidst ancient monuments and bridges, offers a plethora of dining options, bustling markets and jazz clubs. Explore the past and the present with our guided tour for a truly surreal experience.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Old Town Square
thingsToDo.text: Despite Prague’s lively history of invasions, the Old Town Square has remained relatively untouched since the 10th Century. Swarms of tourists crowd the historical streets, packing out the alfresco restaurants everyday. The square itself is the perfect place to admire the wonderful architecture Prague has to offer and if that isn’t your thing then the various street performers, musicians and merchants that line the streets here will certainly keep you entertained.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll across the Charles Bridge
thingsToDo.text: Whoever said that “the best things in life are free” may well have been referring to the Charles Bridge in Prague. A simple walk across the 14th Century bridge is one of the most enjoyable and memorable experiences of visiting Prague. The bridge was commissioned in 1357 by Charles IV to replace an older bridge that had been washed away by floods. Although completed in 1390, with the striking statues added in the 17th century, the bridge did not take Charles’ name until the 19th century.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Prague Castle
thingsToDo.text: Located in Hradcany (the Castle district), Prague Castle is without a doubt the city’s most popular tourist attraction and it is easy to see why. The breath-taking castle has traditionally been the seat of Czech rulers and is today the official residence of the president.

thingsToDo.name: Drink a world famous beer (or two)
thingsToDo.text: The Czechs claim to have the best beer (pivo) in the world and Prague is a great place to test their claim. The huge choice of bars in the city offer famous Czech lagers such as Budvar and Staropramen alongside craft beers from the top microbreweries in the country. Most Czech beers are light beers, brewed naturally from hand-picked hops.

thingsToDo.name: Immerse yourself in the Prague nightlife
thingsToDo.text: Prague’s nightlife has it all. World renowned for its jazz and classical music, there are many live music venues in Prague that can provide a good evening of entertainment. Take a stroll down the riverside and arrive at JazzDock which draws some of the best local jazz musicians. For serious clubbers, the Cross Club is an industrial nightclub in every sense of the word.

places.name: Cesky Krumlov
places.description: A fairy-tale pop-up of a town that crowns a series of bluffs on the edge of the Vltava River south of Ceske Budejovice, Cesky Krumlov is one of the veritable jewels of South Bohemia. Its Old Town bears a well-deserved UNESCO tag for its maze of medieval streets, 13th century relics and layers of architectural history – much of which has remained unspoilt by conflict and war.

thingsToDo.name: Take in the Sights at the Ceský Krumlov Castle
thingsToDo.text: The massive Ceský Krumlov Castle complex – the largest in Eastern Europe – dominates the old town and offers a fascinating look into the lives of the aristocratic rulers of Bohemia through the centuries. Although tracing its roots back to 1240, much of what's seen today was built in the 17th century, including the fine Rosenberg Ballroom, the splendid Chapel of St. George, the Renaissance Hall, and the Royal Apartments.

thingsToDo.name: Explore Art City: Fine Frescoes and the Egon Schiele Art Centrum
thingsToDo.text: A highlight of a visit to Ceský Krumlov is simply walking its many old streets and soaking up the splendid artwork that is everywhere around you. The city is famous for its many frescoes, a tradition that dates back centuries.

thingsToDo.name: Experience Rafting Down the Vltava River
thingsToDo.text: The fairytale town of Cesky Krumlov is perfect to be enjoyed from the water, as you raft down the Vltava River and past stunning architecture. You can hop on a raft just steps from the castle and go downstream towards Ceske Budejovice, another dreamy town with its own magical Old Town. On the way you'll pass by the town of Zlata Koruna and its old monastery and have a chance to stop by waterfront snack stands to grab a bite or a cold drink.

thingsToDo.name: Climb Mount Klet
thingsToDo.text: Located on the outskirts of Ceský Krumlov, the 1,084-meter-high Mount Klet' makes an excellent diversion after all that sightseeing in the historic old city. Getting there is half the fun, and reaching the summit can be done on foot by following the well-marked trails, or aboard a fast chairlift

places.name: Brno
places.description: Pulsing with an indelible student energy during term times from its place in the southern depths of the Czech Republic, Brno – the regional capital of South Moravia – belies its local rep as a rather sleepy place with some of the country’s top drum and bass clubs and a booming café culture to rival both Prague and Vienna. There’s also a gorgeous Old Town district to see; the second largest in the country, where the spiked Neo-gothic towers of the Cathedral of St Peter and Paul stand watch over cobbled squares and the eerie tunnels of the Brno Ossuary lurk underground. Spilberk Castle crowns a bluff in the midst of the town too, while Brno Reservoir is a hubbub of recreational activity during the summer, offering boating, swimming and al fresco drinking opportunities aplenty.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Old Town Hall
thingsToDo.text: Here you get an idea of Brno’s enduring sense of fun, as well as a neat view of the city from the roost of the tower. On approach you might notice that one of the turrets on the Town Hall’s decorative facade looks a bit skewed. The story goes that Anton Pilgram, the building’s architect was screwed out of money by Brno’s City Council and his payback was to mess with the design. The other version holds that he was simply too drunk to get it right. The building goes back to the 1200s, and formed part of the city defences during the famous siege by Swedish forces in 1645.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Freedom Square – Namesti Svobody
thingsToDo.text: Freedom Square (Náměstí Svobody in Czech) is one of the main hubs of activity and interest in the city. It’s also among the top things to do in Brno. The triangular square is surrounded by a number of stunning Renaissance and functionalist style buildings. Sure to please any architecture enthusiast!

thingsToDo.name: Visit Zelny trh aka the Cabbage Market
thingsToDo.text: Vegetables, Mozart, hidden underground labyrinths, fabulous vegan ice cream, and Baroque architecture. This and more can be found in Brno’s Zelny trh square.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Capuchin Crypt
thingsToDo.text: The Capuchin Crypt in central Brno is the final resting places of the mummified remains of Capuchin monks. A self-guided tour with an English pamphlet is a good way to kill half an hour, especially on a rainy day.

places.name: Ostrava
places.description: Sat just on the northern edge of Moravia, where the Czech Republic gives way to Silesia and the Polish borderlands, Ostrava is a down-to-earth gem of a city that fuses historical beauty and Baroque brilliance in its old town with an interesting mix of Soviet Realism, Russian Brutalism and post-industrial sprawl.

thingsToDo.name: Vitkovice
thingsToDo.text: In case you need proof of Ostrava’s pride in its industrial roots the vast industrial remnants of the Vitkovice metallurgy district have been cherished and transformed into modern attractions. The cavernous gasometer is a concert hall, while the 19th-century blast furnace is part of a tour that includes a 60-metre-high lookout accessed by an industrial elevator. The whole district is on the European cultural heritage list.

thingsToDo.name: Landek Park
thingsToDo.text: It’s fitting that Ostrava should boast the Czech Republic’s premier mining attraction, because people have been making use of the mineral deposits in Landek Park since time immemorial. Landek Park puts you right in the boots of a miner, to experience the good and not so good sides of industrialised mining in Ostrava over the last two centuries.

thingsToDo.name: Miniuni Miniature Park
thingsToDo.text: This is a fun diversion for families with younger children. In a landscaped 1.5-hectare park are some 30 models of famous landmarks from around the world. The Brandenburg Gate, The Eiffel Tower and London’s Houses of Parliament are all here, carefully constructed at a scale of 1:25. A recent update has brought the Wonders of the Ancient World to this corner of the Czech Republic.

thingsToDo.name: Ostravar Brewery
thingsToDo.text: Ostravar, which comes in light beer and light lager varieties (Original and Premium), isn’t a household name outside of upper Moravia, but has a big local market. Beer is of course the Czech Republic’s national drink, and at this 19th-century brewery you’ll be walked through the brewing process, from the brewhouse with its large copper vats, to the cellar where the beer develops its depth.

places.name: Moravian Karst
places.description: A land of more than 1,000 caves and grottoes, gorges and canyons, the Moravian Karst sprawls out over a whopping 92 square kilometers just north of the city of Brno. It’s famed for its array of breathtaking geological wonders, going from the sculpted stalactites and colossal stalagmites, underground rivers and sinkholes of the Punkva Caves to the domed chambers and winding corridors of the vast Amaterska system. The place is also home to the great Macocha Gorge – the largest sinkhole canyon of its kind in all of Central Europe that plays host to the bubbling headwaters of the Punkva River. Hiking, caving and biking opportunities abound here, and travelers can also seek out the Josefov blast furnaces and Chateau of Rajec nad Svitavou nearby.

places.name: Bohemian Paradise
places.description: The first ever natural reserve in the Czech Republic is an enchanting land of towering hoodoos and canyons, curious chiselled cliffs, cascading gores and rugged hills, all dressed in sweeping dashes of pine forest, crisscrossed by winding hiking trails and dotted with the romantic silhouettes of castles like the precipitous Trosky keep. Visitors touring the region can delve into ancient rock towns that protrude almost organically from the sandstone ridges they stand on, explore dramatic dolomite caverns at Bozkov, see folksy timber architecture between the rustic villages, go lake hopping, kayaking or canyon scaling, enjoy horse riding in the shadow of ancestral chateaux – the list goes on!

name: England
description: Welcome to England. A land steeped in history, royalty, and culture. Head over to London’s most vibrant, cosmopolitan streets. Marvel at the wonder of Stonehenge. Explore Leeds Castle or spend an idyllic day on the south coast by Brighton Beach. Take a tour to the rolling countryside and charismatic villages. No matter which vacation package you choose, one thing’s certain, you will leave smitten by England’s charm.
weather: Relatively temperate and temperamental. While it doesn't experience extremes during either summer or winter, it’s best to pack an umbrella.
bestTimeToVisit: Any time of the year. Overall, spring (late March to early June) and autumn (September to November) are most popular, when it's usually warm and dry.

thingsToDo.name: Watch one of Shakespeare’s plays in his hometown
thingsToDo.text: Shakespeare’s Globe on the South Bank in London is a pretty special spot to watch one of the Bard’s beloved plays, but there’s nowhere better than Will’s hometown in Warwickshire. Head to Stratford-upon-Avon to see a performance at the Royal Shakespeare Theatre on the river’s edge.

thingsToDo.name: Follow in the footsteps of The Beatles
thingsToDo.text: Take a magical mystery tour around the city of Liverpool in northwest England. It’s where the famous foursome first met. Step inside the National Trust-owned homes where John Lennon and Paul McCartney spent their childhoods. Head to The Beatles Story, the world’s largest permanent exhibition devoted to the musical icons and their history.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll along the South Bank in London
thingsToDo.text: There’s so much to see in central London it’s hard to know where to start. We’d recommend setting off from the gardens beneath the London Eye, with views of Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament, and walking east along the South Bank.

thingsToDo.name: Fly a broomstick at the Harry Potter Studio Tour
thingsToDo.text: Potterheads the world over will know England as the home of The Boy Who Lived. There are filming locations dotted all over the country, but true fans will want to head straight for Leavesden Studios, where the majority of the movies were filmed.

thingsToDo.name: Sip sparkling wine on an English vineyard
thingsToDo.text: Not many people think of wine when they think of the English countryside, but Chapel Down vineyard in Kent is giving France a run for its money. The Chapel Down winery is set in 22 acres of vineyards and it’s open to visitors all year round.

places.name: London
places.description: Planning a trip across the pond? From finding Abbey Road to catching the changing of the guards at Buckingham Palace, we can help you revel in London’s endless activities. Take exciting tours of iconic landmarks like Westminster Abbey and the Tower Bridge. Then, follow it up by exploring the famous Portobello street market in Notting Hill. The possibilities are endless in this capital city.

thingsToDo.name: See the Buckingham Palace
thingsToDo.text: A trip to London is incomplete without strolling through Green Park to catch a glimpse of Buckingham Palace. The palace has been home to the British Royal Family since 1837. It features 775 rooms and the largest private garden in London.

thingsToDo.name: Take the Thames Cruise
thingsToDo.text: The Thames is the lifeblood of London, bringing industry to the city for centuries. It is England’s longest river, leading into the North Sea at its end. It has been the base for settlements since prehistoric times, and was a strategic importance to the Romans and English Kings, as well as during both World Wars.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the London Eye
thingsToDo.text: A trip to London isn’t complete without a visit to the iconic London Eye. Originally constructed to celebrate the millennium, the Eye is a giant ferris wheel offering gorgeous views across the city. At night, the wheel is lit up in seasonal colors and is the centerpiece of London’s annual New Year’s fireworks display.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Hyde Park
thingsToDo.text: Hyde Park is possibly the most famous park in London, and it is one of the largest. The park has historical significance, having hosted a number of demonstrations and protests including protests by the Suffragettes.

places.name: Manchester
places.description: Manchester is England’s second biggest city, having been settled since 79 AD by the Romans. Manchester is a vibrant urban hotspot with excellent nightlife, arts and culture. The city is surrounded by countryside and the gorgeous Pennine mountains, making it a great base for exploring wilder regions of the country. Manchester has an extensive history and is important in many fields, including music, science and transport.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Manchester Museum
thingsToDo.text: The Manchester Museum is the country’s biggest university museum with a collection of 4,500,000 items from all around the world. The museum is housed within a striking gothic-style building and showcases the best in archaeology and natural history.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Manchester Art Gallery
thingsToDo.text: Manchester Art Gallery is situated in the city centre, in a building that has stood on this space since 1823. The gallery celebrates local and international work with an extensive collection that spans centuries. Here you will find paintings by artists such as Gainsborough, Turner and Pissarro. The gallery also features collections of crafts, from ceramics to metalwork and home items, as well as clothing and accessories dating from 1600 to the modern day.

thingsToDo.name: See the Old Trafford
thingsToDo.text: For football fans, a visit to Old Trafford football stadium is a must. Home to Manchester United FC since 1910, the stadium is the largest in the country and one of its most iconic. Book a tour for a unique experience through the football grounds, backstage, and into the on-site museum.

thingsToDo.name: Experience Manchester’s Craft Beer
thingsToDo.text: Manchester is well-known for its craft beer scene which has sprung up over the past few years. There are many pubs and bars offering real ale and home-brewed craft beer, and even annual festivals celebrating the city’s beer.

places.name: Oxford
places.description: From the glorious Bodleian Library to the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford is jam-packed with fantastic things to see and do. It has incredible architecture, superb art and a storied past dating back to Anglo-Saxon times – here, you can follow in the footsteps of Prime Ministers, poets and, of course, Harry Potter.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the Bodleian Library
thingsToDo.text: The Bodleian is the historic heart of the University of Oxford. It’s the institute’s main research library and one of the oldest in Europe, dating back over 400 years. It sits in Radcliffe Square and houses ancient manuscripts, rare books, printed ephemera and maps.

thingsToDo.name: Smell the roses at the University of Oxford Botanic Garden
thingsToDo.text: The oldest of its kind in England, Oxford’s small botanic garden was founded in 1621 for the study of medicinal plants, and remains a department of the university today. It is run more for research purposes than for display, but it’s in a tranquil and colourful spot beside the River Cherwell.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Oxford University Museum of Natural History
thingsToDo.text: Here, you can see specimens from all over the world, including a 150-year-old Japanese spider crab, a stunning example of neogothic architecture and a meteorite that fell from space 4.5 billion years ago. But it’s the dinosaurs that really draw the crowds. As well as a towering T-Rex skeleton – ‘Stan’, the second most complete ever found – you’ll see pieces of Megalosaurus, which, in 1677, was the first dinosaur ever mentioned in a written text.

name: France
description: France is the world’s leading travel destination and for good reason. With us, you can stroll Paris’s bohemian Latin Quarter, see the Mona Lisa at the Louvre, and view the glittering Eiffel Tower. Glamour meets the coast in the sun-drenched French Riviera. Bask in the sun in the Côte d’Azur’s St. Tropez, Nice, and Cannes. Ski the French Alps, follow the Michelin Guide to some of the world’s most renowned three-star restaurants, or journey to a Château in Bordeaux or Burgundy, and taste the local wines.
weather: Temperatures vary from average lows in the mid-thirties in the winter to highs in the mid-seventies in the summer. Pack an umbrella for July.
bestTimeToVisit: June to August brings ideal weather, and the crowds. September to October is beautiful and less crowded.

thingsToDo.name: Get a Little Glamour in the French Riviera
thingsToDo.text: Bask on the beaches of the Côte d’Azur, and follow the stars to Cannes and St. Tropez, or wander the flower market of Nice.

thingsToDo.name: Follow the Wine Trail
thingsToDo.text: Taste some of France’s most exquisite wines in Burgundy, toast your day with authentic Champagne in Champagne, or visit Bordeaux to trace winemaking from the vine to your glass.

thingsToDo.name: Parisian Masterpieces
thingsToDo.text: Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Rembrandt, Venus de Milo and the Winged Victory in the Louvre; Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower—Paris is a city of artistic and architectural masterpieces.

places.name: Paris
places.description: With so many gorgeous things to do in Paris, it’s no wonder that the French capital is on the top of so many people’s bucket lists. Some of the must-do unique experiences in Paris include photographing the Eiffel Tower, exploring the Louvre, admiring the stunning Notre Dame, and seeing the world-famous cabaret at the Moulin Rouge, but there’s much more!

thingsToDo.name: Admire the Exterior of Beautiful Notre Dame
thingsToDo.text: Notre Dame Cathedral is and will always be the beating heart of Paris. Despite the devastating fire in April 2019, which destroyed part of the cathedral, a visit to Notre Dame is still one of the most iconic places in Paris for tourists to visit.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Iconic Artworks at the Louvre
thingsToDo.text: From the Royal Palace to the world’s most visited museum in the world, you cannot miss the Louvre, one of the most iconic sites in Paris!

thingsToDo.name: Walk through the Tuileries Gardens
thingsToDo.text: Either before or after you visit the Louvre, be sure to stop by the nearby Tuileries Gardens. This is a lovely place to relax with friends and family or to explore the beautiful gardens, particularly in spring and summer when the flowers are in full bloom.

places.name: Nice
places.description: Nice’s unofficial anthem is Nissa La Bella, and you can’t help but agree with this sentiment when you visit the French Riviera’s largest city.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Promenade des Anglais
thingsToDo.text: There are seaside walks, and then there’s the Promenade des Anglais, which is more than just a grand walkway next to the Mediterranean: It’s been an integral part of Nice city life (something the recent attack won’t change) since this embankment was built in the 1820s.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Vieille Ville
thingsToDo.text: The oldest part of the city is a change from Nice’s broad boulevards and expansive squares like Place Masséna.

thingsToDo.name: Try the food
thingsToDo.text: This one city has contributed a lot to French cuisine, and there are a handful of local dishes you can’t leave Nice without trying.

places.name: Marseille
places.description: Marseille is one of the top places to visit in Southern France. The capital of Provence (and pastis!) boasts an interesting cultural scene, beautiful landmarks, and 300 days of sunshine.

thingsToDo.name: See the Basilica Notre Dame de la Garde
thingsToDo.text: This impressive stripped building with the perfect setting on the top of the Garde Hill represents one of the most iconic views of Marseille together with the Old Port.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Marseille’s Old Port
thingsToDo.text: The Old Port is Marseille’s beating heart, the city’s main gate to the Mediterranean Sea and the far East. In the 19th century, all the commercial port activities were moved further north, and today the Old Port is a lively picturesque marina and a popular gathering place amongst locals.

thingsToDo.name: See the Cathédrale La Major
thingsToDo.text: Marseille’s Cathedral ‘La Major’ is the main religious building in the city. One of the top things to see in Marseille, the cathedral is located in the historic neighborhood of Le Panier, not far from the MuCEM.

name: italy
description: Language and culture, food and fashion, art and architecture, history and myths... all fill your senses as you set foot in bella Italia. Whether it’s the gondola rides and soft sunsets at Venice, the sweeping landscape and vineyards in Tuscany or the iconic larger-than-life sites in Rome—Italy invites you to slow down and soak it all in.
weather: The climate varies considerably from the north to the south of Italy. North has extreme winters and summer. Central is milder, as is the South. Always check local weather.
bestTimeToVisit: Any time of the year. Overall, April to June and September to October are most popular, when it’s comfortably warm.

thingsToDo.name: Go on a Gondola
thingsToDo.text: See Venice as it was intended to be seen, from the water. Let your gondolier take you through the quiet canals for an enchanting time.

thingsToDo.name: Tour Pompeii
thingsToDo.text: Carved out of a single block of marble, Michelangelo's statue of David is truly iconic. See it in the 'flesh' at the Accademia Gallery in Florence.

thingsToDo.name: Rome on Wheels
thingsToDo.text: From the Spanish Steps, Colosseum, and Pantheon, to the gorgeous Trevi Fountain—pick a bike, Segway, Vespa, or golf cart tour to see it all.

places.name: Rome
places.description: Italy’s vibrant capital has all the evidence of once being the Caput Mundi or capital of the world. From the Roman Forum and the Colosseum, to the Pantheon, these ancient sites intertwine effortlessly with present-day Rome. In addition to marveling at the relics of the golden age, lap up the current dolce vita lifestyle.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Colosseum
thingsToDo.text: Take a guided tour of the great arena of gladiators and travel back to the time when man and beast were made to battle for entertainment.

thingsToDo.name: Take a priority tour of Vatican City
thingsToDo.text: Avoid the long lines and enter the Sistine Chapel as a VIP. Admire Michelangelo's masterpiece at your own pace with an audio guided tour.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Roman Forum
thingsToDo.text: Step back two millennia into what was the center of ancient Roman religious and political life, now in the middle of modern Rome.

places.name: Milan
places.description: From historic attractions, like The Last Supper painting, the world’s largest Gothic cathedral, and the famous La Scala Opera, to A-list fashion houses like Prada, Versace, and Armani, Milan offers its visitors a blend of the traditional and the ultra-modern. Whether you want to soak in some history at the Duomo; indulge in retail therapy at the Quadrilatero district; take in some culture at the Pinacoteca di Brera, or head to Navigli for a cocktail, we can customize your vacation package with insider insights to experience the best of Milan.

thingsToDo.name: Check out Milan’s Horizon
thingsToDo.text: Ride the elevator to the roof of the Duomo Cathedral. See the sculptures and church spires up-close against Milan’s skyline.

thingsToDo.name: Take a walking food tour
thingsToDo.text: Savor the city’s famous cuisine while walking through the historic district of Brera–where old-world charm meets a youthful downtown vibe.

thingsToDo.name: Take a day trip to Lake Como
thingsToDo.text: Explore the tranquil Lake Como, ringed by beautiful villages, exquisite villas, and snow-peaked Italian Alps.

places.name: Venice
places.description: With its spectacular setting and architectural heritage, Venice always enchants. Virtually unchanged for over 600 years, this city on a lagoon is famed for its weathered buildings, picturesque canals, arched bridges, pedestrian streets, soft sunsets and an old-world charm.

thingsToDo.name: Go on a Gondola
thingsToDo.text: See Venice as it was intended to be seen, from the water. Let your gondolier take you through the quiet canals for an enchanting time.

thingsToDo.name: Take a day trip to Burano
thingsToDo.text: Shop for locally-made lace items in this little town of hundreds of colorful houses.

thingsToDo.name: Enjoy Venice by foot
thingsToDo.text: Explore the city’s mysterious past on a night tour through the backstreets.

name: Arizona
description: Arizona is known as the “Grand Canyon State” and for good reason. There are few places on earth that find themselves on most people’s bucket lists, and standing on the rim of the Grand Canyon, watching the sun set over the ribbons of red rock, is one of them.
weather: Summers can get into the triple digits. Winters are mild, but pack a jacket if you plan to visit higher elevations.
bestTimeToVisit: Visit between November and April, when the weather is mild. In the Spring, the desert blossoms.

thingsToDo.name: Sunset on the Rim of the Grand Canyon
thingsToDo.text: As the sun sets, six million years of exposed rock in this UNESCO World Heritage site turn bright red, deep purple, and orange—a breathtaking experience.

thingsToDo.name: Feel the Energy of Sedona
thingsToDo.text: Sedona is a wild landscape of red rocks and pilgrims looking to capture the energy vortexes said to exist among the stones.

thingsToDo.name: Find Your Oasis
thingsToDo.text: In Arizona, many of the spa experiences come with stunning views of the desert or the red rocks, and incorporate native traditions and New Age healing rituals.

places.name: Grand Canyon
places.description: This massive natural wonder gives Arizona its nickname as The Grand Canyon State, and it's understandable why the attraction is a source of pride for the state. Former President Theodore Roosevelt was right when he said, 'In the Grand Canyon, Arizona has a natural wonder which is in kind absolutely unparalleled throughout the rest of the world.' Travelers can hike or ride mules around the North Rim or raft the Colorado River to explore this national park.

places.name: Sedona
places.description: Outdoor enthusiasts flock to this central Arizona town to enjoy its stunning scenery. Regularly described as one of the most beautiful places in America, Sedona dazzles with its famous red rocks and hiking trails (found in Red Rock State Park), as well as its vortexes.

places.name: Tucson
places.description: With an average of more than 350 days of sunshine per year, Tucson draws sun-seekers in droves. When you're not lounging by the pool, you can spot native animals like coyotes and prairie dogs at the 98-acre Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum or take a drive along the Mount Lemmon Scenic Byway for stunning photo-ops.

thingsToDo.name: Head for the desert at the Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum
thingsToDo.text: Sprawling over 98 acres and featuring an aquarium, zoo, botanical garden, natural history museum, and art gallery, Arizona-Sonora Desert Museum can be found to the west of Tucson. The museum focuses on educating visitors regarding the various flora and fauna that can be found in the Sonoran Desert region, and houses of 200 species of desert animals and over 1,000 types of plants.

thingsToDo.name: Hike the Sabino Canyon
thingsToDo.text: Located just north of Tucson, the Sabino Canyon is nestled in the Santa Catalina Mountains and the Coronado National Forest. The canyon offers magnificent trails, majestic views, and hiking and trekking opportunities.

thingsToDo.name: Learn all about aerospace at the Pima Air & Space Museum
thingsToDo.text: Proudly known as one of the largest air and space museums in the world, aerospace buffs can see over 300 aircraft and spacecraft at the facility that has a span of over 80 acres.

thingsToDo.name: Star gaze at Kitt Peak National Observatory
thingsToDo.text: For those visitors who want to get closer to the stars, Kitt Peak National Observatory offers the perfect views of the night sky. An astronomical observatory sits atop Kitt Peak in the Quinlan Mountains and boasts the largest and most diverse astronomical equipment in the world that includes 24 telescopes.

places.name: Phoenix
places.description: Being one of the most beautiful places in America, Phoenix is a charming capital city of Arizona. Throughout the year, it boasts beaming sun and delightfully warm temperatures, and its expanses of dry desert are among the reasons it is so well-loved.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Arizona Science Center
thingsToDo.text: The Arizona Science Center is a public science museum and is widely considered the greatest in the state, so the fact that it’s in Phoenix – and right close to Heritage Park – makes it a great source of excitement for tourists!

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Camelback Mountain
thingsToDo.text: Camelback Mountain, rising 2,700 feet above the ground, is among the most beautiful and most scenic site seeing and hiking spots in Phoenix.

thingsToDo.name: See the Tovrea Castle
thingsToDo.text: A castle is the last thing you’d expect to find in a desert, but Arizona aims to surprise its visitors every time. Located within easy reach of the Airport Gateway District of Phoenix, the Tovrea Castle was originally a high-end hotel built by Alessio Carraro and his son.

name: California
description: California’s relaxed vibe, beautiful beaches, and pristine wilderness draws diverse crowds. There’s San Francisco’s iconic Golden Gate bridge, Los Angeles’s glitzy movie scene, and San Diego’s famous zoo. Taste your way through the Sonoma and Napa wine valleys. Venture to California’s iconic national parks. Stand before Yosemite’s granite cliffs, marvel at Sequoia National Park’s majestic trees, and experience the awe-inspiring silence of the Mojave Desert. Drive along the Pacific Coast Highway and see Big Sur.
weather: California’s climate is warm and dry in the summer and mild and wet in the winter. If you’re visiting the desert or the mountains, you’ll experience more extreme weather.
bestTimeToVisit: Year-round

thingsToDo.name: Ride a Cable Car in San Francisco
thingsToDo.text: You can ride San Francisco’s iconic cable cars through the city’s neighborhoods and destinations. See the Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman’s Wharf, and the Mission District.

thingsToDo.name: Land of National Parks
thingsToDo.text: Few national parks evoke quite the awe that Yosemite inspires. See the massive granite cliffs from Glacier Point. Visit Sequoia and see the world’s largest trees, or venture into the desert and visit Joshua Tree or Death Valley.

thingsToDo.name: Search for the Stars in Hollywood
thingsToDo.text: Los Angeles is still the land where movies are made. Visit Hollywood or Disneyland in nearby Anaheim.

places.name: Los Angeles
places.description: Los Angeles draws immigrants and dreamers from across the country and the world, creating a melting pot of cuisines and cultures. Only in LA can world-class cuisine be found hidden in a strip mall restaurant. Visit the city’s world-class museums, follow the stars to the Hollywood Hills, browse the shops on Rodeo Drive, or bask on one of the city’s beaches.

thingsToDo.name: Discover the Art Scene
thingsToDo.text: View contemporary art at the Broad, take in the view and masterpieces at the Getty Center, and discover art that spans the eras at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll the Hollywood Walk of Fame
thingsToDo.text: While the TCL Chinese Theatre is a tourist hot spot, this famous stretch of sidewalk is iconic.

thingsToDo.name: Bike or Drive Sunset Boulevard
thingsToDo.text: From the gritty clubs of Sunset Strip, the star’s mansions of Bel Air and Beverly Hills, to the shores of Malibu, Sunset Boulevard embodies all that Los Angeles is and all that it aspires to be.

places.name: San Francisco
places.description: Take iconic photographs of the Golden Gate Bridge from the park. Ride a cable car down the city’s sweeping hills. Mingle with the tourists at Fisherman’s Wharf and take a ride out to Alcatraz.

thingsToDo.name: Cross the Golden Gate Bridge
thingsToDo.text: Rent a bike or walk across the bridge, or visit Fort Point National Historic Site for the best photo.

thingsToDo.name: Fisherman’s Wharf
thingsToDo.text: Fisherman’s Wharf is a must-see, but it’s bustling with tourists. From here, ride one of the city’s iconic cable cars or take a boat to Alcatraz for a glimpse back in time.

thingsToDo.name: Find Your Neighborhood
thingsToDo.text: The murals of the Mission District, the culture of Chinatown, the history of the Castro, and the innovation of Silicon Valley—San Francisco’s neighborhoods are diverse and vibrant.

places.name: Palm Springs
places.description: A lush green oasis in the picturesque California desert, romantic Palm Springs is all about sun-worshipping, unrivaled recreation, world-class spas, spectacular natural landscapes, awesome Mid-Century Modern architecture, great entertainment, and fabulous shopping.

thingsToDo.name: Tour Mid-Century Modern Homes & Buildings
thingsToDo.text: See and learn about hundreds of homes and buildings by extraordinary architects who transformed Palm Springs into the 'New Capital of Cool'.

thingsToDo.name: Spectacular Vistas from Mount San Jacinto
thingsToDo.text: Ride the Palm Springs Aerial Tramway 8,500 feet up to the top of Mount San Jacinto for awesome views.

thingsToDo.name: Hike in Joshua Tree National Park
thingsToDo.text: Home of the distinctive Joshua Tree yucca, this 800,000-acre park in the Mojave Desert encompasses two separate ecosystems at different altitudes.

name: Florida
description: Whether you want the vibrant nightlife and Latin flavor of Miami’s South Beach, the surf culture of Cocoa Beach, the quiet shores of Anastasia State Park, or the powder white sand and sunsets of Sarasota’s Gulf beaches, there’s a beach to match your style.
weather: Mild weather most of the year, with hot and humid summers.
bestTimeToVisit: Winter brings milder temperatures. Summers can be quite hot, though popular.

thingsToDo.name: Snorkel John Pennekamp State Park
thingsToDo.text: Florida has the only living coral barrier reef in the United States, and you can snorkel or dive it at John Pennekamp State Park in the Florida Keys.

thingsToDo.name: Feel Miami’s Latin Spirit
thingsToDo.text: Miami boasts a blend of Caribbean, South American, and Central American culture and cuisine, with a backdrop of Art Deco architecture.

thingsToDo.name: Soak with the Manatees in a Cold Spring
thingsToDo.text: Florida has more springs than any other state—from the natural lazy river of Ichetucknee Springs to the winter manatee haven at Manatee Springs.

places.name: Miami
places.description: Miami is a city where you can spend your morning working on your tan on South Beach, explore the Art Deco architecture after lunch, and party into the night. Marvel at the blend of Latin American and Caribbean cultural influences, with cuisine to match. Sip a margarita the size of your head while sitting on Ocean Drive, and watch the parade of fashion, bling, and fancy cars. Still, nature is never far away. Miami is surrounded by the sea and the Everglades.

thingsToDo.name: Experience Ocean Drive
thingsToDo.text: From the sparkling shores of South Beach to oversize margaritas and people-watching from the patios of the Art Deco hotels—Ocean Drive is quite an experience.

thingsToDo.name: Hit the club
thingsToDo.text: The Miami party scene spans cultures and genres—from open-air salsa, velvet rope VIP clubs, to electronic dance music, indie rock, and rap clubs. Sip a craft beer over music in Wynwood, or put on your dancing shoes at South Beach.

thingsToDo.name: Eat at Versailles Restaurant in Little Havana
thingsToDo.text: Visit the world’s most renowned Cuban restaurant for a café con leche and an authentic Cuban sandwich.

thingsToDo.name: See the Alligators
thingsToDo.text: Take an airboat ride through Everglades National Park, and meet the alligators and incredible birds that call this wetland home.

places.name: Orlando
places.description: Orlando is best known for its glittering theme parks. Meet your favorite characters at the Magic Kingdom, explore the world of tomorrow at Epcot, and journey into the savannah at Disney’s Animal Kingdom. Enter the Wizarding World of Harry Potter at Universal or ride the coasters at Islands of Adventure™. Beyond the thrills of the parks, Orlando is a vibrant city in its own right.

thingsToDo.name: Enter a World of Magic at Walt Disney World
thingsToDo.text: From the Magic Kingdom with Cinderella’s Castle to Animal Kingdom’s wild encounters, there’s something for the kids and for the kids at heart at Walt Disney World.

thingsToDo.name: Splash Around at a Water Park
thingsToDo.text: Play at Disney’s Blizzard Beach and Typhoon Lagoon or enjoy Universal’s Volcano Bay.

thingsToDo.name: See the Ballet or Broadway
thingsToDo.text: Enjoy a change of pace from the theme parks with a ballet or Broadway production at the Dr. Phillips Center for the Performing Arts.

places.name: Key West
places.description: Key West is quirky, charismatic, and unique. On Duval Street, find rowdy bars beside high-end art galleries. Get a photo of the “southernmost point in the United States” landmark. When sunset rolls around, walk to Mallory Square for a sunset celebration like no other. Visit the Ernest Hemingway house and meet the author’s famous six-toed cats. After exploring the island, the beach awaits.

thingsToDo.name: Stroll Duval Street
thingsToDo.text: Walk Duval Street and experience Key West’s culture and nightlife—from the famous Sloppy Joe’s Bar to charming art galleries and drag shows—Duval Street offers a little something for everyone.

thingsToDo.name: Celebrate the Sunset at Mallory Square
thingsToDo.text: As the sun sets, Mallory Square comes alive with street performers and music.

thingsToDo.name: Key Lime Pie at Blue Heaven
thingsToDo.text: At Blue Heaven restaurant you can enjoy a delicious slice of key lime pie in the restaurant’s outdoor yard, where Key West’s chickens roam.

thingsToDo.name: Beaches and Reefs
thingsToDo.text: Bask on the sand at Fort Zachary Taylor Historic State Park or take a catamaran to a coral reef off the coast.

name: New York
description: After you’ve visited New York City’s landmarks, venture beyond to the wonders of New York State. See the New York side of Niagara Falls. Go boating, swimming, or climbing at Lake George in the Adirondacks. Visit the Hudson Valley’s Catskills for fall foliage, hiking, and biking. The Storm King Art Center and the Women’s Rights National Historic Park in Seneca Falls are museums off the beaten path. Long Island boasts State Park beaches and wineries.
weather: New York has all four seasons. In the summer, temperatures are in the 80s (but are warmer in New York City). Fall and spring bring milder temperatures, with winter temperatures ranging from the teens to the high thirties.
bestTimeToVisit: Year-round

thingsToDo.name: Visit New York City
thingsToDo.text: The Statue of Liberty, the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, and Broadway—New York City offers nightlife, parks, cuisine, museums, and history.

thingsToDo.name: See Spectacular Niagara Falls
thingsToDo.text: Take the Maid of the Mist Boat tour to the base of the falls, or enjoy time at the Niagara Falls casinos.

thingsToDo.name: Get Outside in New York
thingsToDo.text: The Adirondacks and the Catskill Mountains offer year-round outdoor fun, from skiing in the winter to hiking, mountain biking, and climbing in the summer, to watching the fall foliage in the autumn.

places.name: New York City
places.description: One of the greatest cities in the world, New York is always a whirlwind of activity, with famous sites at every turn and never enough time to see them all. Some people come here to enjoy the Broadway shows; others come specifically to shop and dine; and many come simply to see the sites: the Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building, Brooklyn Bridge, Central Park, historic neighborhoods, and numerous world famous museums.

thingsToDo.name: Statue of Liberty
thingsToDo.text: America's most iconic sight, the Statue of Liberty is at the top of every first-time visitor's list of things to do in New York. It was France's gift to America. Built in 1886, it remains a world symbol of freedom and is one of the top attractions in America.

thingsToDo.name: Central Park
thingsToDo.text: A walk, peddle, or carriage ride through the crisscrossing pathways of Central Park is a must-do on anyone's New York City itinerary. In winter, you can even lace up your skates and glide across Wollman Rink. This huge park in the city center, a half-mile wide and 2.5 miles long, is one of the things that makes New York such a beautiful and livable city.

thingsToDo.name: Rockefeller Center & Top of the Rock Observation Deck
thingsToDo.text: When it comes to New York attractions, Rockefeller Center is on almost all tourist's itineraries. This vast entertainment and shopping complex in the middle of Manhattan is home to NBC-TV and other media, but the centerpiece is the 70-story 30 Rockefeller Plaza, an Art Deco skyscraper that offers awesome views over Manhattan from the famous Top of the Rock Observation Deck.

thingsToDo.name: Broadway and the Theater District
thingsToDo.text: Attending a Broadway show is one of the top things to do in New York City. Considered the pinnacle of American theater, this is the place to see the latest shows and the long-running classics.

thingsToDo.name: Empire State Building
thingsToDo.text: The Empire State Building is one of New York's most famous landmark buildings and key tourist attractions. The 381-meter-tall, 102-storey building was the tallest in the world until the 1 World Trade Center tower rose higher, 41 years later. Topped with a mooring mast for airships, the Empire State Building immediately became a landmark and a symbol for NYC when it opened in 1931.

thingsToDo.name: Times Square
thingsToDo.text: Lined with huge, brilliantly lit billboards and screens, Times Square is the place to go in New York in the evening, but still exciting at any time of day. This is the location of New York's New Year's Eve Celebrations and the famous 'ball drop' at midnight, when the square and surrounding streets are filled with people.

thingsToDo.name: Bryant Park
thingsToDo.text: On a summer's day, it's hard to beat a leisurely afternoon at Bryant Park. The grounds feature monuments and gardens, and 'Le Carrousel,' a popular carousel. A games area makes available chess boards, checkers, and backgammon boards for a small fee.

places.name: Catskill
places.description: Bid adieu to the hustle and bustle and say hello to Catskill, NY, where you’ll find limitless acres of landscapes, ripe with opportunities for outdoor adventure and festivals and events that can rival any big-city lineup. Catskill is the perfect getaway from the city or for a week-long vacation with family or friends.

thingsToDo.name: Kaaterskill Falls
thingsToDo.text: Just 22 minutes outside the city of Catskill, Kaaterskill Falls is one of the most popular hikes in the area, mainly because it is a short hike to a huge, 260-foot (80 meter) payoff, divided over two drops. This is the highest two-tiered waterfall in the state of New York. Its upper tier measures an impressive 175 feet (54 meters), while its lower tier is 85 feet (26 meters) tall.

thingsToDo.name: Hunter Mountain
thingsToDo.text: Hunter Mountain is a true four-season resort, offering a wide variety of events, activities, and accommodations year-round, where the fun here doesn’t stop when the snow melts! Get away to the heart of the beautiful Northern Catksills and enjoy Hunter Mountain’s Scenic Skyride Chairlift, which brings you to the summit of Hunter Mountain.

thingsToDo.name: Greene County Council on the Arts
thingsToDo.text: If you want to know anything about art, go to Greene County Council on the Arts for shows, exhibitions, and information. A well-oiled machine so to speak, the county council runs this place efficiently and have been cultivating, curating, presenting and advocating for the arts in Greene County for over 40 years, which is a remarkable achievement. The council maintains an active gallery on Main Street in Catskill, NY, a popular children’s arts program, and join forces on a wide selection of installation projects, for professionals and amateur enthusiasts alike.

places.name: Niagara Falls
places.description: The Niagara Falls are among the most impressive and best-known falls in the world. They lie in the extreme northwest of New York State along the U.S./Canadian border, which is formed by the Niagara River. Here, masses of water from Lake Erie plunge over an almost 200-foot drop to flow into Lake Ontario, attracting more than 12 million visitors a year.

places.name: Herkimer Diamond Mines
places.description: For gemstone collectors, one of the most unique upstate New York getaways can be mining your very own treasure! Contrary to their name, Herkimer Diamonds are not really diamonds. They are 500,000 million-year-old surface quartz crystals and are abound in this area.

name: Hawaii
description: Golden-sand beaches, cascading waterfalls, lush rainforests, rugged canyons, and spectacular sunsets… Hawaii is the paradise destination that exceeds expectations.
weather: Temperatures are consistently warm but comfortable throughout the year.
bestTimeToVisit: Year-round

thingsToDo.name: Indulge in a traditional Hawaiian luau
thingsToDo.text: Get entertained by Hawaiian musicians, hula dancers, and fire twirlers, alongside an authentic feast.

thingsToDo.name: Check out three beaches (in three colors)
thingsToDo.text: Big Island’s black, white, and green beaches are a sight to behold and certainly great to explore.

thingsToDo.name: Experience an ocean adventure
thingsToDo.text: Snorkeling, scuba diving, surfing, whale watching, a sunset cruise… there are plenty of choices, and Hawaii the perfect location for all.

places.name: Honolulu
places.description: A town of rolling surf and seaside cocktail shacks that represents the cultural kingpin of Hawaii as a whole, this Polynesian-flavored American state capital rarely fails to impress.

thingsToDo.name: Hit the sands of Waikiki Beach
thingsToDo.text: It’s hardly surprising that world-famous Waikiki Beach once drew the kings and queens of the Hawaiian archipelago to its sands.

thingsToDo.name: Wax up the surf boards and hit the waves
thingsToDo.text: No trip to Hawaii’s fun-loving, surf-mad capital could possibly be complete without at least a mention of this most popular of local pastimes.

thingsToDo.name: Keep company with Hawaiian kings at the glorious ʻIolani Palace
thingsToDo.text: The ancestral home of the revered Kalakaua Dynasty sits nestled in the midst of the Honolulu downtown. Contrasting with the modern builds all around, this 19th-century palace oozes a Francophone, Italianate charm from each of its terraces and Baroque come classical nooks and crannies.

places.name: Maui
places.description: Whether you come to Maui for its natural beauty, stellar sunsets, prime whale watching or 81 gorgeous beaches, there’s never a lack of things to do on Maui.

thingsToDo.name: Witness a Haleakala sunrise
thingsToDo.text: The highest point on Maui is atop Haleakala, the largest dormant volcano in the world, which reaches an impressive 10,023 feet and attracts hundreds of thousands of visitors each year. While a 2 a.m. wake up call may not sound like most people’s idea of a relaxing vacation activity, it’s worth it.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the road to Hana
thingsToDo.text: A winding road of more than 600 turns and 50 one-lane bridges, the Road to Hana is unlike any other drive you’ll experience. Leading you through 68 miles of lush Maui rainforest, this is a drive that’s sure to surprise even the most avid nature-lovers. Enjoy hiking through bamboo forests, visiting organic fruit farms, standing in lava tubes, swimming in freshwater caves, frolicking in waterfalls, and discovering the true beauty of Hawaiian paradise.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Molokini Crater
thingsToDo.text: Located two miles off of Maui’s South shore, Molokini Crater is a natural crescent and Marine Life Conservation District frequented by snorkelers and scuba divers from around the world. With visibility that exceeds 180 feet on good days and thousands of tropical reef fish swimming below and alongside you, Molokini is a can’t miss for those of you planning on exploring Maui’s underwater life.

thingsToDo.name: Go whale watching
thingsToDo.text: If you’re in Maui between December and April, lucky you! Approximately 10,000 humpback whales swim from the Gulf of Alaska to Hawaii each year to birth and nurse their calves in the shallow, warm water before making the long journey back. The Auau Channel between Maui and Lana’i is one of the most popular spots to witness these majestic animals, which can be seen from shore, boat, kayak, outrigger canoe, stand up paddle board, helicopter and, for the lucky couple, even scuba diving.

name: Texas
description: Texas is ranch country, deserts, big cities, and remote wilderness. There’s Austin’s live music scene, Dallas’ museums, and Houston’s NASA Johnson Space Center. While in the big city, grab some delicious Tex-Mex. Visit the Alamo outside San Antonio. Beyond the cities, you’ll find miles of coastline and the natural splendor of Big Bend National Park.
weather: Weather varies depending on where you’re going in the state. South Texas sees year-round mild weather, while the north gets cooler.
bestTimeToVisit: Year-round

thingsToDo.name: Raft, Hike, and Soak in Big Bend National Park
thingsToDo.text: Big Bend National Park has a natural hot spring by the Rio Grande. Hike the Chisos Mountain Range, and raft down Santa Elena Canyon.

thingsToDo.name: San Antonio’s River Walk
thingsToDo.text: After visiting the Alamo, take a stroll down San Antonio’s River Walk where you can people-watch, eat, and enjoy the scenery.

thingsToDo.name: Beach Time at South Padre Island
thingsToDo.text: Go deep sea fishing, watch for sea turtles, and get your adrenaline going with kite surfing or kiteboarding.

places.name: Dallas
places.description: A well-rounded city growing out of the stark North Texas prairie, Dallas has a jumble of ultramodern skyscrapers, the largest arts district in the United States, museums of the highest quality and pulsating nightlife.

thingsToDo.name: Dealey Plaza
thingsToDo.text: In Dallas you can visit a place where the course of history was changed forever. The landmarks at Dealey Plaza, like the Texas School Book Depository, the Grassy Knoll and Elm Street as it bends down to the railroad tracks, would be unremarkable were it not for the assassination of John F. Kennedy on November 22, 1963.

thingsToDo.name: Arts District
thingsToDo.text: Dallas lays claim to the largest urban arts district in the United States, on 20 square blocks to the south-east of Uptown, and with a rare concentration of cultural attractions.

thingsToDo.name: Nasher Sculpture Center
thingsToDo.text: Raymond Nasher (1921-2007), the developer behind the NorthPark Center mall, was a voracious art collector, and together with his wife Patsy assembled a jaw-dropping sculpture collection.

thingsToDo.name: Reunion Tower
thingsToDo.text: One of the towers that make Dallas, Dallas arrived to the south of Dealey Plaza in 1978. Also known as The Ball, the 171-meter Reunion Tower is four narrow shafts (one cylindrical and thee rectangular) crowned with an openwork geodesic dome illuminated at night by 259 LEDs.

places.name: Austin
places.description: With everything from wild mountain ranges to hip and trendy bars, Austin is one of the most vibrant cities in Texas.

thingsToDo.name: Lady Bird Lake
thingsToDo.text: With glittering waters and tree-lined shores, Lady Bird Lake is one of the most beautiful attractions in Austin, and it can offer hours of entertainment for outdoor enthusiasts.

thingsToDo.name: Museum of the Weird
thingsToDo.text: With its eye-popping colors and brain-bending oddities, the Museum of the Weird is one of the most unique things to see in Austin. t’s the only place in the city where you can find shrunken heads next to melted wax figures next to gigantic statues of movie monsters.

thingsToDo.name: Downtown Austin
thingsToDo.text: With its gleaming buildings and waterfront views, Austin has one of the most recognizable skylines in the entire state of Texas. However, there are just as many fun things to see on the ground! Shops and restaurants line the sidewalks. Malls, museums, art galleries and performance theaters offer a fun night on the town.

thingsToDo.name: Austin Nature and Science Center
thingsToDo.text: You won’t want to miss the Austin Nature and Science Center. While it offers family-friendly fun that can be enjoyed by all ages, it holds a special kind of magic for children. Maybe it’s because of the wildlife center that houses everything from birds to bobcats. Maybe it’s because of the “dino pit” where little paleontologists can dig up their own rocks, fossils and gemstones. At this destination, you can enjoy education and entertainment all rolled into one, so it should please parents and kids alike.

places.name: Houston
places.description: Houston, named after former General Sam Houston who, in 1836, won the Battle of San Jacinto which gained Texas its independence from Mexico, is the fourth most populated city in North America and home to approximately two and a half million residents. It is a magnet for tourism, being closely linked with the Space Center Houston, and NASA’s astronaut training and flight control complex together with many other interesting attractions.

thingsToDo.name: Museum of Natural Science
thingsToDo.text: The Houston Museum of Natural Science (abbreviated as HMNS) has an amazing collection of mineral specimens, space station models, 60 large skeleton mounts – which include four Tyrannosaurus Rex and three large Quetzalcoatlus – a planetarium, and lots more to occupy the family for the day.

thingsToDo.name: Space Center Houston
thingsToDo.text: One of the city’s topmost attractions, the space center is home to more than 400 artifacts together with an abundance of both permanent and traveling exhibits as well as other displays relating to America’s awesome space flight programs.

thingsToDo.name: Downtown Aquarium
thingsToDo.text: This splendid six acre dining and entertainment complex was made even more amazing by the amalgamated redevelopment of two of Houston’s landmarks, the Central Waterworks Building and Fire Station No.1.

thingsToDo.name: Miller Outdoor Theatre
thingsToDo.text: This outstanding theater offers both culturally and artistically assorted daytime children’s programming as part of its free productions season as well as many other free plays, concerts, dances and shows to suit all ages.

name: China
description: With its bustling cities, iconic relics, tombs, and temples, China is an incredible country of great diversity. The list of sights to see and things to do is virtually endless. From the stunning skyscrapers of Hong Kong to the ancient Great Wall, the mighty Yangtze river to the incredible Terracotta Warriors, China is where centuries old traditions blend with urban flair. Where rugged natural scenery and cutting-edge technology both have their rightful place.
weather: Chinese climate varies from region to region. Always check weather based on destination.
bestTimeToVisit: April-October, when the weather is warm and dry.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Beijing Opera
thingsToDo.text: Enjoy the fascinating music, singing, costumes and performance of a traditional opera. Then try on a few opera costumes and make-up, too.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Forbidden City
thingsToDo.text: Visit the Forbidden City with a local guide and learn about the Imperial Palace which was home to 24 emperors from 1420 until 1924.

thingsToDo.name: Head to the Great Wall, China
thingsToDo.text: Take a tour of one of the great wonders of the world as it winds up and down across varied terrains like a dragon.

thingsToDo.name: Ride the Shanghai Maglev Train
thingsToDo.text: Take a ride on the world's fastest, most futuristic passenger train. At the speed of 268 mph, you'll zip from the downtown Beijing area to the airport in only eight minutes!

places.name: Beijing
places.description: Behind the bustle and buzz of modernity, Beijing’s iconic destinations invite you to delve into this capital city’s amazing past. From the historic Forbidden City, and the awe-inspiring Great Wall, to the 100-acre Tiananmen Square, and the enchanting hutong alleys, you’re in for a cultural treat in Beijing. With opera and punk rock, sidewalk food vendors and elegant restaurants, Beijing fuses contradictions and contrasts into one remarkable experience.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Beijing Opera
thingsToDo.text: Enjoy the fascinating music, singing, costumes and performance of a traditional opera. Then try on a few opera costumes and make-up, too.

thingsToDo.name: Explore the Forbidden City
thingsToDo.text: Visit the Forbidden City with a local guide and learn about the Imperial Palace which was home to 24 emperors from 1420 until 1924.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the silk factory
thingsToDo.text: From silkworms to cocoons, learn how silk is made and see beautiful silk bedding and garments.

thingsToDo.name: Head to the Great Wall, China
thingsToDo.text: Take a tour of one of the great wonders of the world as it winds up and down across varied terrains like a dragon.

places.name: Shanghai
places.description: The introduction to China's largest city often begins with a ride on the world's fastest passenger train, which symbolizes this rapidly growing destination. Now home to over 25 million people, this “Paris of the East” is prized for its retail therapy and Western-style entertainment, while giving a nod to its centuries-old history and traditions.

thingsToDo.name: Ride the Shanghai Maglev Train
thingsToDo.text: Take a ride on the world's fastest, most futuristic passenger train with a maximum cruising speed of 268 mph.

thingsToDo.name: Get away from the hustle-bustle
thingsToDo.text: Visit the Ming Dynasty-era Yu Garden and Old Bazaar Yuyuan Garden, a place of peace and comfort in the heart of bustling Shanghai.

thingsToDo.name: Visit a water village
thingsToDo.text: Take a tour of the village of Zhouzhuang, which is surrounded and divided by lakes and rivers, and dates back more than 900 years.

thingsToDo.name: Head to the French Concession
thingsToDo.text: For a taste of old Shanghai check out the French Concession, lined with old villas and lane houses from the early 1900s.

places.name: Xi'an
places.description: Located in central-northwest China, 3,000-year-old Xi'an was the capital for 13 Chinese dynasties and 73 emperors, and is the acknowledged root of Chinese civilization. Bearing witness to the great changes within the country, it’s today a treasure trove of history and culture. From the being the eastern terminal of the Silk Road, home to the famed Terracotta Warriors, museums, historical ruins, and cultural relics, Xi’an has a special place in your China itinerary.

thingsToDo.name: Make a trip to the Terracotta Warriors
thingsToDo.text: Discovered as recently as 1974, see the Terracotta Army of over 7,000 soldiers, horses and chariots that’s been guarding Emperor Qin's tomb since 210 BC.

thingsToDo.name: Bike or stroll along the ancient City Wall
thingsToDo.text: Get a great view of the city from the top of this his massive city wall that’s been guarding the inner city for over 700 years.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Shaanxi History Museum
thingsToDo.text: Discover more than 1,700,000 cultural relics, including exhibits of ancient living from 115,000 years ago.

thingsToDo.name: Take a tour of the Big Wild Goose Pagoda
thingsToDo.text: Located in the royal temple complex, it’s the earliest and largest square tower built of bricks during the Tang Dynasty.

name: Japan
description: A mystifying blend of modern and ancient, every aspect of Japan will leave you fascinated. This 'Land of the Rising Sun' with Cherry Blossoms, sushi, saké and Zen gardens, that are so integrated in world culture, is a bucket-list destination for most. Whether you immerse yourself in the hustle-bustle of Tokyo, the traditional splendor of Kyoto or the volcanic hot springs of Fukuoka’s—Japan's blend of tradition, natural wonder, and ultra-modernity makes it a country unlike any other.
weather: Generally temperate, with four distinct seasons.
bestTimeToVisit: March-May and from September-November.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Mt. Fuji
thingsToDo.text: Whether you hike to the top or take it all in from the observation deck, visiting this UNESCO World Heritage site is an unforgettable experience.

thingsToDo.name: Go on a fast ride
thingsToDo.text: Hop onto a Japan Railways bullet train from Tokyo to Kyoto, and watch the Japanese countryside whiz by in a 220 mph blur.

thingsToDo.name: Indulge in sushi
thingsToDo.text: Dine on the finest sushi, served at popular hole-in-the-wall joints to Michelin-starred masterpieces in Tokyo.

thingsToDo.name: Explore historic Kyoto
thingsToDo.text: One of the few cities spared the devastation of World War II, the streets and architecture have remained unchanged for over 1,000 years.

places.name: Tokyo
places.description: Tokyo is a city that needs almost no introduction, having been featured in countless films, TV shows and music videos. An icon of popular culture, Tokyo is also a city that never sleeps, so you will never be short of things to do when you are in town.

thingsToDo.name: Visit Asakusa
thingsToDo.text: The Asakusa District of Tokyo is known for being the home of the Senso-ji temple which is also one of the top sights in the city. The temple is covered in gorgeous design elements and carvings, and visitors flock here to pray and drink in the serene and relaxed vibes.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the Imperial Palace
thingsToDo.text: One of the top spots in Tokyo for visitors is the Imperial Palace which is the home of the emperor and sprawls over 2,000,000 square meters. Located in the Marunouchi District close to central Tokyo Station, you need to book in advance if you want to visit.

thingsToDo.name: Watch a baseball game
thingsToDo.text: Many people don’t realize that Japanese locals love the sport of baseball, so if you are in Tokyo then it makes sense to also watch a game when you are in town. There are a number of different teams here such as the Tokyo Swallows and the Yomiuri Giants, and you can watch a game at a number of stadiums around the city.

thingsToDo.name: Go shopping in Akihabara
thingsToDo.text: The Akihabara District of Tokyo is located around Akihabara Station and is also called ‘Electric Town’ in English. It is known primarily for its quirky venues such as maid cafes and cosplay bars which many tourists want to visit as these kinds of attractions are unique to Japan and you can learn more about the otaku culture here.

thingsToDo.name: Tour the Sumo Museum
thingsToDo.text: When people think of Japan they often also think of its national sport of Sumo wrestling. With that in mind, if you want to learn more about this amazing sport, then you need to head to the Sumo Museum which is free to enter and will fill you in on all the history.

thingsToDo.name: Enjoy the Cherry Blossom Festival at Yasukuni Shrine
thingsToDo.text: Yasukuni Shrine is one of the top places to come if you are in Tokyo for the cherry blossom season from March to May. You can see cherry blossom trees in bloom all over the city but one of the best places to do so is at Yasukuni Shrine as this is also the home of the Sakura Festival and there are some 600 cherry trees here.

thingsToDo.name: Have a night out singing karaoke
thingsToDo.text: Everyone knows that Japan is famous for karaoke bars and with that in mind you should make sure to spend some time singing along to some of you favorite tunes.

thingsToDo.name: Visit a cat cafe
thingsToDo.text: Japan is now known for its unusual cafes and one of the most famous is the Cat Cafe in Nekorobi. f you love felines but don’t have your own pet, then you can come here and check out all the resident cats here as well as get a coffee or a bite to eat at the same time.

thingsToDo.name: Tour Ghibli Museum
thingsToDo.text: Anyone who is a fan of Japanese cartoons Spirited Away and Princess Mononoke should make sure to head to the Ghibli Museum as it was Studio Ghibli who produced these iconic animated films. You can walk around a number of galleries here and check out some of the original sketches from the animations and you can also see models of some of the characters from the films.

places.name: Kyoto
places.description: Japan is a land of dichotomy, always maintaining a balanced approach to modern advancement and tradition. Where other cities in Japan have technology, Kyoto has temples, reigning as the country’s cultural capital. Those who venture to Kyoto can expect magical sights of bamboo forests, ornate shrines and temples, impeccably dressed geishas, theatre performances, rambunctious monkeys, and blooming cherry trees when the season permits. Travelers can learn all about art, tea, Zen Buddhism, and other pillars of Japanese culture all within the borders of this easily-accessible city.

thingsToDo.name: Wander through the incredible Fushimi Inari-taisha Shrine
thingsToDo.text: Kyoto’s most iconic treasure, the Fushimi Inari-taisha Shrine is located at the end of a flamed colored walkway made up of thousands of traditional torii gates. Visitors can easily spend a day wandering through the trails surrounding the network of ornate shrines. Half way up the mountain, expect incredible views of Kyoto at the Yotsutsuji Intersection.

thingsToDo.name: Visit the Kinkakuji Temple
